arch:property.oc:show_val: the Locus 1 soil removed between the West Balk and Locus 2 the East Perimeter Wall; the Locus 10 soil of the Water Canalization System Passage, the Locus 11 soil between Loci 5 and 4 and 7, the Locus 15 soil and ashlar fall from the East Perimeter Wall to its east, and the Locus 17 test trench excavated parallel to the Locus 2 East Perimeter Wall.
1.30 m in length and a depth of 0.26 m.
Locus 2 East Perimeter Wall and Locus 20 Bedrock.
Accumulation of topsoil, disturbance and collapse.
From Locus 2 East Perimeter Wall to the beginning of the southern expanse of bedrock Locus 20.
This is a deposit of ashy olive colored sandy soil Munsell 5Y4/4, which may have been the localized part of a work area.
Phase XII: Use levels, robbing and abandonments continue. Upper levels of fluvial wash are deposited. Rooms A and B are abandoned.
Phase XIII: Major collapses continue into the Islamic period.

Phase XI: Further collapse post-CE 5th c., possibly the result of the earthquake of 512. Fill accumulates following the disuse of the canalization systems. The remains of two bodies are found in the upper level fluvial deposits. Localized burning in some areas.
